intro: Denckea, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It comprises about 10 species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Denckea species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are adapted to grow in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments.
